general_advisory: Watch for rain before applying pesticides. If necessary spray only when sky becomes clear and use sticker to the spray solution. In fallow uplands, utilizing recent rainfall farmers should take up short duration low water requiring crops like black gram, green gram, sesame, fodder crops etc. Regular surveillance work should be taken up in all crops in order to know the incidence of various insect pests and initiate the control strategies.

advisory: Keep the rice plots weed free.
For neck blast disease management apply Tricyclazole (Beam) @ 0.6 g/l of water (120 g/ac).
To control steam borer & leaf folder spray chlorpyriofos/profenofos @ 2 ml/ l of water.
Spray Imidachloprid @ 0.6 ml / liter of water to control the BPH.
In upland matured rice harvest the crop and store it in a safe place.
Root and stalk rot may observe in maize field, to control it spray Validamycin 3% L @ 2 ml/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water.
Install pheromone traps @ 15 nos /acre to control fall army worm.
For blast disease management apply Merger (Tricyclazole 18 % + Mancozeb 62 % WP ) @ 1 -1.5 g/l or Tricyclazole 75% WP (Beam) @ 0.6 g/l of water (120 g/ac) or Zineb 75% WP @ 2 g/l of water.
To manage collar rot infestation in ground nut, spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% WP @ 2 g/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water.
Root rot may observe in green gram and black gram, to control it soil drenching with Validamycin 3% L @ 2 ml/litre of water or Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% WP @ 2 g/litre of water.
For harvesting early in winter season, go for sowing of radish and nursery raising of cabbage and cauliflower.

Rainfall may cause wilting and damping off disease in seedlings and young plants of vegetables. To control it soil drench with Copper oxycloride 50% WP @ 3 g and Streptomycin + Tetracycline (90+10) @ 0.15 g/litre of water when sky becomes clear.

Prepare nursery beds, each measuring 3m length, 1m breadth and 15 -20 cm height. Apply 15 -30 kg well decomposed FYM and 150 grams of chlorpyriphos dust to each nursery bed seven days prior to sowing. In case of improved varieties, 200 -250 grams of seed is required for one acre area of cultivation and 100 -150 grams of seed is required in case of hybrids.
Cauliflower (60 -75 days) - HYV: Pusa Early Synthetic, Early Kuanri, Kartika, Pusa Dipali, Arka kranti, Arka Surathi, Hybrid: Sweta, Puspagiri, Tusar Goodman etc.

Prepare nursery beds, each measuring 3m length, 1m breadth and 15 -20 cm height. Apply 15 -30 kg well decomposed FYM and 150 grams of chlorpyriphos dust to each nursery bed seven days prior to sowing. In case of improved varieties, 200 -250 grams of seed is required for one acre area of cultivation and 100 -150 grams of seed is required in case of hybrids.
Cabbage (60 -75 days) - HYV: Golden Acre, Pride of India, Pusa Sambandh Hybrid: Green ball, Priya, Genith gold star, Pragati etc.
